channel.title: Saving an Int/Variable
channel.description: Okay, i created a members status and its default is 0. If i set a player to Member = 1 then the player logs in, it resets their Member to 0. How do i stop this? Help please?? :)

item.title: Saving an Int/Variable
item.dc:creator: @Scape-JAVA Scape-JAVA
item.description:
@Scape-JAVA wrote:

[code=java]
public class BufferedReader {

         BufferedReader in =
	new BufferedReader(new FileReader(""));

try {
new = BufferedReader(new FileReader(""));
read = in.readFile(){

	in.close();
} catch (IOException e) {
System.out.println("" + e);
}

}

public void main(string args[]) {
	File File = new File();
}

}

[/code]

That’s somewhat like how a ban/mute files read the text file.

Read full topic

item.title: Saving an Int/Variable
item.dc:creator: @Tom Tom
item.description:
@Tom wrote:

When I ran a server a long time ago, I used a file that it would read from instead of actually saving it. Very much like bans/mutes etc work on most servers.

Example:

if (checkLog("members", playerName)) {
// things to do
}

You obviously have to make the file.

Read full topic

item.title: Saving an Int/Variable
item.dc:creator: @system system
item.description:
@system wrote:

Okay, how would i do that? could you do a step by step? :S
Thanks

Read full topic

item.title: Saving an Int/Variable
item.dc:creator: @QuestMaster_2K10 QuestMaster 2K10
item.description:
@QuestMaster_2K10 wrote:

You need to save the variable so it writes to the character file that can be loaded again everytime the player logs back in. Otherwise you’re shit out of luck.

Read full topic

item.title: Saving an Int/Variable
item.dc:creator: @Tom Tom
item.description:
@Tom wrote:

funnerscape:

Nope, if i remove that then it goes crazy, complaining it cant find the int Members :S

Don’t remove the deceleration of the value. But remove anything that’s editing the value i.e int++;

Also, it sounds like you’re not saving it. look at your saving/loading method in client class /playerhandler class. It should be obvious what to do from there.

Read full topic

item.title: Saving an Int/Variable

item.description:

item.title: Saving an Int/Variable
item.dc:creator: @Tom Tom
item.description:
@Tom wrote:

Need more information, but I’ll go of a 317. In the initiate method there should be something like

Member = 0;

Remove that. It could also be in the process method. Try that and if it doesn’t work there’s another way. Also, make sure this value is saving to the character file.

Read full topic
